Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of possibly a horse (only haunch and hind leg remaining), to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number 17 written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd might refer to the location the sherd was found at the site of Tell Dafana.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 39, pl. 23, no. 34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.018) (Phase 1)
